article:
'HER2' (Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor 2) also known as 'Neu', 'ErbB-2',
'CD340' (cluster of differentiation 340) or 'p185' is a protein that in humans
is encoded by the ERBB2 gene. HER2 is a member of the epidermal growth factor
receptor (EGFR/ErbB) family. Amplification or over-expression of this gene has
been shown to play an important role in the pathogenesis and progression of
certain aggressive types of breast cancer and in recent years it has evolved to
become an important biomarker and target of therapy for the disease.
